snippet: A West African trade bloc imposed sanctions as separatist and Islamist fighters continued their sweep across northern Mali.
abstract: West African trade bloc imposes tough sanctions against military officers who overthrew the president of Mali, even as rebels secure the ancient desert crossroads of Timbuktu, virtually sealing their control over the northern half of the nation.

byline.contributor: J. David Goodman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A West African trade bloc imposed sanctions as separatist and Islamist fighters continued their sweep across northern Mali.

headline.seo: Mali Coup Leaders Suffer Sanctions and Loss of Timbuktu
headline.main: Mali Coup Leaders Suffer Sanctions and Loss of Timbuktu
headline.print_headline: Neighbors Cut Off Mali Coup Leaders, and Rebels Capture Timbuktu

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
